item.title: Software Engineering Journal Reviews
item.description: Formal Software Design Alloy is an open-source language and analyzer for software modeling. An Alloy model is a collection of constraints that describe a set of structures, e.g. all possible security configurations of a web application. Alloy’s tool, the Alloy Analyzer is a solver that takes the constraints of a model and finds structures that satisfy them. ðŸ“‘ The Alloy Analyzer leverages a SAT solver, and this precludes Alloy from analyzing optimization problems.
